intro: Calycorectes acutatus, commonly known as the sharp-pointed calycorectes, is a unique flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with prominent calyces that enclose the buds. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a lanceolate shape with serrated edges. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
